articles.title: EU gas price rockets higher after Russia halts Nord Stream flows - Reuters
articles.description: European gas prices rocketed as much as 30% higher on Monday after Russia said one of its main gas supply pipelines to Europe would stay shut indefinitely, stoking renewed fears about shortages and gas rationing in the European Union this winter.

articles.title: Euro slides below $0.99 after Russia halts gas supplies to Europe - CNBC
articles.description: The euro has fallen below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years after Russia said it would shut off its main gas supply pipeline to Europe indefinitely.
articles.content:
The euro fell below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years Monday, after Russia said it would shut off its main gas supply pipeline to Europe indefinitely.

articles.title: Russia's Gazprom keeps pipeline shut as Siemens disputes maintenance challenge claims - CBC News
articles.description: Russia kept one of its main gas supply routes to Europe shut on Saturday, stoking fears of winter fuel shortages and spotlighting differences between Gazprom and Germany's Siemens Energy over repair work on the pipeline.
